intro: Pentacaena camphorosmoides, commonly known as the camphorosmoides or the African camphor tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves that are oppositely arranged on the stems. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, round, red berries. It is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments. The tree is also noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its relatively drought-resistant nature.
